intro: Popowia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis popowia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features include hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, making it distinct within its genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
